an9.29:4.1: “Mendicants, there are nine grounds for resentment.
an9.29:4.3: Thinking: ‘They did wrong by me,’ you harbor resentment.
an9.29:4.4: Thinking: ‘They are doing wrong by me’ …
an9.29:4.6: ‘They did wrong by someone I love’ …
an9.29:4.7: ‘They are doing wrong by someone I love’ …
an9.29:4.8: ‘They will do wrong by someone I love’ …
an9.29:4.10: They are helping someone I dislike’ …
an9.29:4.11: Thinking: ‘They will help someone I dislike,’ you harbor resentment.
an9.29:4.12: These are the nine grounds for resentment.”
